description: UI Fixes v6 - Sorting toggle, Score modal radar chart color, and remove redundant sort buttons

userStories.title: Fix Column Sorting Toggle on Same Column
userStories.description: As a user, I want to click the same column header repeatedly to toggle between ascending and descending order.
acceptanceCriteria: sortRows() function toggles currentSort.dir when the same metric is clicked
sortRows() function updates currentSort.metric on each call to track current column
Add toggle logic: if (currentSort.metric === metric) { currentSort.dir *= -1; } else { set metric and initial direction }
Initial direction for time/score/mem is ascending (1), for lang is ascending (1)
The sort arrow rotates 180 degrees when direction is descending (-1)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click Score header twice, observe sort direction toggles

userStories.title: Fix Score Modal Radar Chart Tier Color
userStories.description: As a user, I want the radar chart in the Score modal to display using the same color as the tier badge.
acceptanceCriteria: Verify tierColor is correctly passed to drawScoreRadarChart() in openScoreModal()
Radar chart polygon fill uses tierColor with 0.3 alpha via hexToRgba()
Radar chart polygon stroke uses tierColor
Legend swatch (legendLangSwatch element) background is set to tierColor
Data point dots use tierColor for fill
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: open Score modal for a Tier-A language (green), confirm chart is green

userStories.title: Remove Redundant Sort Buttons from Controls
userStories.description: As a user, I want a cleaner UI without redundant sort buttons since table headers already provide sorting.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove the Name sort button (<button class="btn" onclick="sortRows('lang', this)">Name...)
Remove the Time sort button (<button class="btn active" onclick="sortRows('time', this)">Time...)
Remove the Memory sort button (<button class="btn" onclick="sortRows('mem', this)">Memory...)
Remove the Score sort button (<button class="btn" onclick="sortRows('score', this)">Score...)
Keep PERSONA selector, Show Mismatches toggle, and Diagnostics button
These buttons are located in HTMLGenerator.ts around lines 1052-1055
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: confirm buttons are removed, table header sorting still works
